alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 1:40PM EDT until April 09 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Forsyth and Fulton Counties. For the Big Creek...including Alpharetta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands and fields begin along the creek between Cumming in Forsyth County...to Alpharetta and Roswell in North Fulton County. Flooding starts to effect portions of The Big Creek Greenway near Alpharetta and some portions may become closed with around one foot of water...especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 7.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 01/27/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
